body: Looks easy enough.. Fancy sending a PR?
I have no idea about `Go` but I'll take a look at it :)

issue.title: Fails when file is blocked by Google Drive as malware, despite downloading it

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
When having a file that Google Drive claims to be malware on Google Drive, it sometimes can be downloaded, sometimes not. But rclone gives a negative console output and feedback to programs in both cases.

Link to the RCloneSync issue (closed, because it's really an RClone issue): https://github.com/cjnaz/RCloneSync/issues/19#issuecomment-394171221
There you can also find a link to the underlying Google Drive bug report, but since I would not expect it to be fixed soon, also it can happen again at any time, so RClone should work around it.
On the Google Drive bug report, you can find download links for the two affected files.

#### What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
rclone v1.41-076-g2b332bceÎ²
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.10.1

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Debian, 64bit

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google Drive

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
`rclone sync drive: /home/fabian/drive`

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
Too long to be included completely. But the important parts are in the log without `-vv` anyway:
```2018/06/04 20:51:32 ERROR : programs/titanium/de.robv.android.xposed.installer-de4f0dc569f96dbcc5668d40fa76040b.apk.bz2: Failed to copy: failed to open source object: open file failed: googleapi: Error 403: This file has been identified as malware or spam and cannot be downloaded., cannotDownloadAbusiveFile
2018/06/04 20:53:21 ERROR : Local file system at /home/fabian/drive: not deleting files as there were IO errors
2018/06/04 20:53:21 ERROR : Local file system at /home/fabian/drive: not deleting directories as there were IO errors
2018/06/04 20:53:21 ERROR : Attempt 1/3 failed with 1 errors and: failed to open source object: open file failed: googleapi: Error 403: This file has been identified as malware or spam and cannot be downloaded., cannotDownloadAbusiveFile
2018/06/04 20:53:30 ERROR : programs/titanium/de.robv.android.xposed.installer-de4f0dc569f96dbcc5668d40fa76040b.apk.bz2: Failed to copy: failed to open source object: open file failed: googleapi: Error 403: This file has been identified as malware or spam and cannot be downloaded., cannotDownloadAbusiveFile
2018/06/04 20:55:00 ERROR : Local file system at /home/fabian/drive: not deleting files as there were IO errors
2018/06/04 20:55:00 ERROR : Local file system at /home/fabian/drive: not deleting directories as there were IO errors
2018/06/04 20:55:00 ERROR : Attempt 2/3 failed with 1 errors and: failed to open source object: open file failed: googleapi: Error 403: This file has been identified as malware or spam and cannot be downloaded., cannotDownloadAbusiveFile
2018/06/04 20:55:07 ERROR : programs/titanium/de.robv.android.xposed.installer-de4f0dc569f96dbcc5668d40fa76040b.apk.bz2: Failed to copy: failed to open source object: open file failed: googleapi: Error 403: This file has been identified as malware or spam and cannot be downloaded., cannotDownloadAbusiveFile
2018/06/04 20:56:30 ERROR : Local file system at /home/fabian/drive: not deleting files as there were IO errors
2018/06/04 20:56:30 ERROR : Local file system at /home/fabian/drive: not deleting directories as there were IO errors
2018/06/04 20:56:30 ERROR : Attempt 3/3 failed with 1 errors and: failed to open source object: open file failed: googleapi: Error 403: This file has been identified as malware or spam and cannot be downloaded., cannotDownloadAbusiveFile
2018/06/04 20:56:30 Failed to sync: failed to open source object: open file failed: googleapi: Error 403: This file has been identified as malware or spam and cannot be downloaded., cannotDownloadAbusiveFile```

body: I would very much appreciate this. I have a ton of legitimate files getting flagged as abusive.

OK I've implemented this.

I can't test it though as I don't have any abusive files!

So can you

   * Attempt to download an abusive file.  You should get an error which includes the text "Use the --drive-acknowledge-abuse flag to download this file"
  * Try downloading again with the  `--drive-acknowledge-abuse` flag and check it does download!

Thanks

https://beta.rclone.org/v1.41-090-g6be5a989-fix-2317-drive-abuse/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

without --drive-ackowledge-abuse:

2018/06/08 10:55:33 ERROR : Attempt 3/3 failed with 5 errors and: failed to open source object: open file failed: googleapi: Error 403: This file has not been flagged for abuse., invalidAbuseAcknowledgment
2018/06/08 10:55:33 Failed to copy: failed to open source object: open file failed: googleapi: Error 403: This file has not been flagged for abuse., invalidAbuseAcknowledgment
So it looks like when we receive the error `cannotDownloadAbusiveFile ` we then should retry but adding the `--drive-acknowledge-abuse` flag...
FYI v2 API does not have this issue if the file is abusive, it downloads it regardless.
So, if you use the flag, abusive files do download but non-abusive files will not. I have lots of mixed files so this doesn't help much :/
Thanks for testing.  I will revise the patch!

If you do keep it as a flag, I'd like it if the drive remote had an option
to download all abusive files. Otherwise every copy/sync I do I'll have to
add the flag because I don't know which folders have "abusive" files.

There are no instances in any of my rclone+drive use-cases where I want to
be "protected" from "abusive" files.

On Fri, Jun 8, 2018, 11:29 AM Nick Craig-Wood <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Thanks for testing. I will revise the patch!
>
> â
> You are receiving this because you commented.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/2317#issuecomment-395815082>, or mute
> the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AKOQXbAN5VM7o6yE3ER8nvZMsZt2fUBpks5t6qZigaJpZM4UL_IB>
> .
>

OK here is a revised patch which tries the download without the query parameter and if it fails with that error, retries it with the query parameter if you supply the --drive-acknowledge-abuse flag.

Can you do the two tests again please?

   * Attempt to download an abusive file.  You should get an error which includes the text "Use the --drive-acknowledge-abuse flag to download this file"
  * Try downloading again with the  `--drive-acknowledge-abuse` flag and check it does download!

Here is a beta to try

https://beta.rclone.org/v1.41-092-g3bf9c26a-fix-2317-drive-abuse/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

@jahands wrote:
> If you do keep it as a flag, I'd like it if the drive remote had an option
to download all abusive files

My reading of the API docs makes me thing that I shouldn't be doing this all the time - the user will have to do something to download the file.

The --drive-acknowledge-abuse flag if supplied will allow all abusive files to be downloaded.  You can set this in an environment variable `RCLONE_DRIVE_ACKNOWLEDGE_ABUSE=true`.  When I've finished the config restructure (after 1.42 is released) you'll be able to put it in the config file too.

> Files identified as abusive (malware, etc.) are only downloadable by the owner. Additionally, the query parameter acknowledgeAbuse=true must be included to indicate that the user has acknowledged the risk of downloading potential malware. Your application should interactively warn the user before using this query parameter.

I would consider a user setting an environment variable or setting it in
the config file to be user consent.
